climbs.name: Passion Play
climbs.fa: David Rubine, Martin Wensler and Sherry Levine 4/1980

content.description:
This is an enjoyable route which climbs a slab past two bolts to a two bolt anchor.  The crux is a bit above the 2nd bolt.  To descend, walk off easy slabs to the west.

This is most likely David Rubine's first new route at the Pinnacles. In the late 1980's and 1990's David partnered with the likes of Kelly Rich and Tom Davis to create some of the hardest and boldest routes at the Pinnacles.
content.protection: Two protection bolts to a three bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the right of the two routes in this area.  Locate two bolts.

climbs.name: The Big Bad West
climbs.fa: Jon Cochran, Kurt Cochran and Rose Cochran 1/1999

content.description: This is a good beginner's route which climbs a low angle slab past four bolts to a three bolt anchor.  Walk off easy slabs to the west.  Just make sure you go far enough west(100 ft) to get to easy terrain.
content.protection: Four protection bolts to a three bolt anchor.
content.location: This is the left route in this area.  Locate a low angle slab with four bolts.
